p: In a more recent publication, Kpoviessi et al. (2014) [ 44] presented results that confirm the activity of citral found in the species Cymbopogon citratus (DC.) Stapf against T. brucei. Kpoviessi et al. (2014) also presented positive results for the in vitro antiparasitic activity of essential oils of the same genus: Cymbopogon giganteus Chiov, Cymbopogon nardus L., and Cymbopogon schoenantus L. Spreng. at concentrations of 0.25, 5.71 and 2.10 Î¼g/mL, respectively, when dissolved in DMSO and analyzed using the colorimetric MTT assay [ 15, 16].
